event: Earliest evidence of human habitation in what is now Costa Rica.
Development of complex chiefdoms and trade networks among indigenous peoples.
Christopher Columbus arrives on the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica during his fourth voyage.
Spanish establish Cartago, the first permanent settlement in Costa Rica.
Costa Rica declares independence from Spain as part of the broader independence of Central America.
Costa Rica becomes part of the United Provinces of Central America.
Costa Rica formally declares itself a sovereign and independent state.
Costa Rica defeats American filibuster William Walker in the Battle of Rivas.
Beginning of liberal reforms and expansion of coffee exports.
President Rafael Ángel Calderón Guardia introduces social reforms including labor rights and social security.
Civil war breaks out after disputed elections; José Figueres Ferrer leads the revolution and abolishes the military.
New constitution established; army officially abolished; democratic system consolidated.
President Óscar Arias wins Nobel Peace Prize for efforts to end civil wars in Central America.
Costa Rica joins CAFTA-DR (Central America Free Trade Agreement with the U.S.).
Laura Chinchilla elected as Costa Rica’s first female president.
Costa Rica achieves nearly 100% of its electricity from renewable sources.
Costa Rica deals with COVID-19 pandemic and its economic impacts.
Costa Rica becomes first Central American country to legalize same-sex marriage.
